Recap: Blake blames Jeffrey for the story about Ross and the affair with his assistant as a way to get her to lose the election. Frank finds out more facts about the crash, and wonders if someone was trying to murder Ross. He later asks Gus to investigate. Billy tells Josh that he was the one who arranged to have the divorce papers delivered to Reva. Olivia refuses to sell Josh Cross Creek, but later Cassie offers to sell her half of the Beacon if she will sell it to her and Olivia agrees. Harley has Rick talk to Gus about the pills he is taking and Gus resents that Harley doesn't trust him, but she points out that she knows he went through her purse.

Olivia chats with Buzz at Company, but their talking is very intimate. It's clear that she can really communicate well with him, even though she says she has chosen Frank. She thanks him for helping Frank woo her, and he kisses her hand just as Frank walks up and sees them. Frank brushes Buzz off when he wants to make up. Josh can't convince Olivia to sell him Cross Creek, but Cassie convinces her to sell it in exchange for her half of The Beacon. Josh gets excited about restoring the place to the way it used to be. Cassie invites herself along to help out. Billy gets angry when he finds out that Josh and Reva are back together. He lets Josh know that he is the one that let Reva find the papers; the two brothers argue about Reva.

Harley forces Gus to have leg checked out by Rick, who says it is healing. They are both worried about Gus' pill-popping, and Reva confronts him about the bottle of pills that have been moved in her purse. Gus claims he is fine and gets angry at Harley for going behind his back to Rick and accusing him, but they make up. A tabloid newspaper article has photos of Ross and his personal assistant. Blake accuses Jeffrey of planting it, but he denies it. She is very vulnerable and hurting, and Jeffrey seems to feel sorry for her (and perhaps something more). An FAA Agent gives Frank info about the crash-- it was not an accident. Frank tells Jeffrey, who phones someone about it and finds out that Ross' personal assistant, Nikki, was a private eye. Frank gives the file to Gus to investigate but doesn't want to tell Blake yet. Frank is a little concerned about Gus' leg but gives him a chance after Gus pleads with him.
Transcript: Harley: How many were in here? How many did you actually take?
Gus: Look, ma, caneless!
Harley: Why?
Gus: Why? Because I lent my cane to an old lady. She needed it more than me. Because I'm good, I'm fine.
Harley: You look better.

Gus: Thank you, yeah. I'm going to go stickless. I decided. I'm mostly going to say to everybody who comes across me I'm going to go say, "I'm going to put one foot in front of the other one." It's going to be my new motto: One day at a time.
Harley: You look good, let's try out that leg. Come on.
Gus: Sure.
Harley: Just a little... I knew it. I knew it. I knew it.
Gus: I'm fine.
Harley: You're not fine.
Gus: I am fine.
Harley: Okay, I believe you, you're fine. But I'd like a doctor to confirm that.
Gus: Oh, my God. You're going to drag me to a doctor?
Harley: Gus, we're just going to talk to a doctor and then we can move on from this, okay?

Billy: Stop, that's the message I've been getting all along.
Josh: I know you thought you had another chance, but the divorce papers was a mistake, it was a fluke. I never meant for it to happen.

Blake: Don't, please. I don't need your pity. So whatever I said the other night about my feelings towards Ross and this rumored affair with Nicole Landers, just forget it. I just don't think it's a wise idea for me to open up to my opponent.
Jeffrey: I'll keep that in mind.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: Ooh, thanks. Listen, I want you to know I'm working on the Frank/Buzz situation.
Buzz: Really, how?
Olivia: Well, at the gala the other night, I told Frank that if it weren't for you, he and I probably wouldn't even be together.
Buzz: I'm just so handy, aren't I?
Olivia: I also said straight out that he had to work things out with you, okay? And he said he didn't know how. But that doesn't mean that he doesn't want to. He does. I know he does.
Buzz: Listen to you. What were you, a cheerleader in high school or president of the optimists' club?
Olivia: There was no football in San Cristobel. And I have a fatalistic streak a mile wide. No. Listen, I just really believe with a little work and patience you guys can work through this.
Buzz: ( Laughs )
Olivia: What? What is so funny?
Buzz: It's not funny, it's sweet. You're so eager to make things right between me and Frank.
Olivia: Well, I'm at least half the reason y they're not.
Buzz: It would be a little easier for you to sit on the sidelines, than it would for me to blame you.
Olivia: I would blame me. You're about you, both of you.
Buzz: I know, thank you.
Olivia: I should phone the Beacon. I need to make a call.
Buzz: Yeah. Frank, what a surprise.
Frank: Yeah, nothing like a good surprise.
Buzz: Can I get you.. I've got pizza...
Frank: No thank you. I'm meeting someone here.
Buzz: I thought maybe, you know, we could have a little talk.
Frank: Not now.
Buzz: Frank, I mean, how are we going to...
Frank: I've got a lot going tonight now. All the other stuff is just going to have to wait.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: There it is. See, I told you. The floor plan to Cross Creek drawn by heart.
Cassie: Very impressive. Now, can you draw in the changes that Olivia made when she redecorated.

Josh: Yeah, well, you know what, actually I didn't pay a whole lot of attention last time I was down there. Not that what she did wasn't lovely, but it just didn't... it didn't capture the soul of this place.
Cassie: I see. Well, now it is your place.
Josh: That's right, it is. And you know what else?
Cassie: Hm?

Josh: I can change it back. I can do that. It really wouldn't take that much I mean, a little bit of paint, a little bit of sparkle here and there. I could buy up some used furniture at the local shops there and restore it to the way it was back in the days of H.B. Lewis.
Cassie: The pre-Olivia days.
Josh: The real boys of Cross Creek.
Cassie: You are really jazzed about this?

Josh: You know what else? I just had another idea. I can do it before Reva gets back from her trip. This will be great. It would be like a symbol, you know, proof that we can rebuild our relationship and make it the way that it used to be. In fact, I'm going to get the jet fired up right now, I'll get Hawk to help me out. He can help me put together a crew, and... did I say something wrong here? I mean, you got very quiet all of a sudden. Did I forget to thank you for putting this ball in motion? Because I think I did.
Cassie: No. You thanked me about 50 times. I'm just... I don't know, I'm just wondering when you're going to get around to your asking me to go with you. Don't underestimate my spackling ability.
Josh: You want to come with me to Cross Creek?
Cassie: I am out of work now, remember? And R.J. has never been to Oklahoma, he is on spring break right now.
Josh: Okay, okay. Let's fix that right now. Yeah, it's Josh. Fire up the jet. Cross Creek for three.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: Okay, we should wait for... what are you doing?
Gus: I'm taking an aspirin, all right?
Harley: For your leg?
Gus: Yes. No, for my ear, what do you think? Don't tell Rick I'm still in the hospital. Plus, I'm on the lookout for one of those robes with the flap in the back because they're very comfortable.
Rick: You two all set?
Harley: I think so.
Gus: Let's get out of here.
Rick: Okay.
Harley: We won't be needing these anymore, right?
Rick: Right. I'll see you two up front.
Gus: Thanks, man. Good to see you. Can we go?
Harley: Wait. Baby, you should get a haircut. ( Laughs ) I'm sorry for not trusting you. We're okay, right?
Gus: Yeah, we're good. We're good. Can we go? I can't stand hospitals.
[NEXT_ON]
Lizzie: This is the last chance I have to make Coop love me again. Surprise, surprise, surprise! Happy birthday, Coop.
Ava: You are the birthday boy, and the birthday boy can have whatever he wants.
Lizzie: Abracadabra! Now you see her, now you don't. Poof, she's gone.
